InterpolatingEFT.dataLoader module

Loads data from .ROOT files into a custom torch dataset

class InterpolatingEFT.dataLoader.NLLDataset(X: Tensor, Y: Tensor, POIs: Dict[str, int])[source]

Bases: Dataset[Any]

Torch-compatible dataset for the NLL data

append(new: NLLDataset) → None[source]

Appends a new dataset to the end of this dataset

Parameters:

new (NLLDataset) – The dataset to append

Raises:

ValueError – Raised if the datasets have different coefficients

toFrame() → DataFrame[source]

Converts a NLLDataset to a dataframe

Returns:

The dataset as a dataframe

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

InterpolatingEFT.dataLoader.loadData(filename: str, POIs: List[str], include_best: bool = False) → DataFrame[source]

Loads the data from a ROOT file into a pandas dataframe

Parameters:

  • filename (str) – The path to the file to load

  • POIs (List[str]) – The pois to load the scans for

  • include_best (bool) – Include the best-fit point. Defaults to False

Returns:

The data as a dataframe with a column for each WC

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

InterpolatingEFT.dataLoader.toTorch(file: str, POIs: List[str], include_best: bool = False) → List[Tensor][source]

Convert data from a ROOT file into torch datasets for input and target data

Parameters:

  • file (str) – The path to the file to load

  • POIs (List[str]) – The pois to load the scans for

  • include_best (bool) – Include the best-fit point. Defaults to False

Returns:

The input and target torch tensors in a list.

Return type:

List[torch.Tensor]

InterpolatingEFT.dataSplitter.loadAndSplit(file: str, data_config: Data, split: float, include_best: bool = False) → Tuple[Subset[NLLDataset], Subset[NLLDataset]][source]

Loads the dataset as a train/test split

Parameters:

  • file (str) – The file to load the dataset from

  • data_config (Data) – Options for the data

  • split (float) – The train fraction

  • include_best (bool, optional) – Include the best fit point. Defaults to False.

Raises:

NotImplementedError – Raised if an option other than ‘grid’ is specified

Returns:

The train/test split

Return type:

Tuple[Subset[NLLDataset], Subset[NLLDataset]]

  • label (str) – The legend entry

  • out (str, optional) – The output dir. Defaults to ‘out/default’.

InterpolatingEFT.profiler module

Makes all profiled 1D and 2D scans

InterpolatingEFT.profiler.profile1D(interp: rbfInterpolator, poi: str, num: int = 50, out: str = 'out/default') → None[source]

Get the 1D profiled scan for the specified POI, using an interpolator

Parameters:

  • interp (rbfInterpolator) – The interpolator to use

  • poi (str) – The poi to scan

  • num (int, optional) – The number of scan points. Defaults to 50.

  • out (str, optional) – The out dir. Defaults to ‘out/default’.

InterpolatingEFT.profiler.profile2D(interp: rbfInterpolator, num: int, out: str, pois: List[str]) → None[source]

Get the 2D pairwise profiled scan for the pois specified, using an interpolator

Parameters:

  • interp (rbfInterpolator) – The interpolator to use

  • num (int, optional) – The number of scan points. Defaults to 50.

  • out (str, optional) – The out dir. Defaults to ‘out/default’.

  • pois (str) – The poi pair to scan

InterpolatingEFT.profiler.profileAll1D(interp: rbfInterpolator, pois: List[str], num: int = 50, out: str = 'out/default') → None[source]

Get the 1D profiled scan for all POIs, using an interpolator

Parameters:

  • interp (rbfInterpolator) – The interpolator to use

  • pois (str) – The pois to scan

  • num (int, optional) – The number of scan points. Defaults to 50.

  • out (str, optional) – The out dir. Defaults to ‘out/default’.

InterpolatingEFT.profiler.profileAll2D(interp: rbfInterpolator, pois: List[str], num: int = 10, out: str = 'out/default') → None[source]

Get the 2D pairwise profiled scan for all POIs, using an interpolator

Parameters:

  • interp (rbfInterpolator) – The interpolator to use

  • pois (str) – The pois to scan

  • num (int, optional) – The number of scan points. Defaults to 50.

  • out (str, optional) – The out dir. Defaults to ‘out/default’.

Extracts the data from the 1D and 2D Combine scans

Parameters:

  • data_config (Data) – Options for the data

  • out (str, optional) – The out dir. Defaults to ‘out/default’.

  • out (str, optional) – The out dir. Defaults to ‘out/default’.

Parameters:

  • indent (int, optional) – The indent level. Defaults to 0.

  • from_top (bool, optional) – Whether the calling function had a zero indent. Defaults to True.

The dictionary as html
